Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-GHa (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 61.5% similarity toTemporin-SHc. molecular formula: C72H108N18O15S; Mol Wt: 1465.765; GRAVY = 1.3.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 43300, MRSA or ATCC 25923 (MIC 6.8-26.6 uM);  B.subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC 106.8 uM), P. gingivalis ATCC 33277 (MIC 12.5 uM), B. adolescentis ATCC 15703 (MIC 50 uM), B. breve ATCC 15700 (MIC 100 uM), L. acidophilus ATCC 4356 (MIC 25 uM), S. sanguis ATCC 10556 (MIC 1.6 uM), and S. mutans UA159 (MIC 12.5 uM); Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922, IS or D31 (13.3-53.2 uM); V. alginolyticus IS (MIC 26.6 uM;  P.aeruginosa ATCC 15442 (MIC 106.8 uM); and C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 26.6 uM). The peptide also inhibited biofilm formation.Structure: helical in the presence of SDS or 50% TFE (Jiang et al., 2023). Provided by Yingxia Zhang. Updated Jan2020; 10/2023 GW
Literature Information.Author: Dong Z, Luo W, Zhong H, Wang M, Song Y, Deng S, Zhang Y.2017, China, Asia
Literature Information.Reference: Acta Biochim Biophys Sin (Shanghai). 2017 May 1;49(5):450-457. doi: 10.1093/abbs/gmx023.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Molecular cloning and characterization of antimicrobial peptides from skin of Hylarana guentheri.
